children: A 75-year-old man is evaluated for night sweats, weight loss, chest pain, and dyspnea.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This chest radiograph is most consistent with a pleural-based tumor, which in this case is a mesothelioma. Right-sided multilobulated pleural-based opacification and pleural thickening are present. Although not seen in this patient, additional findings in mesothelioma include pleural effusion, decreased lung volume, and rib destruction. Other changes resulting from asbestos exposure (such as pleural effusion, pleural plaques, and asbestosis) are also often seen in combination with mesothelioma.
